title: Table
description:
Hard wood table, constructed with pegs of the following parts:
4 legs; table top, worked in shape of cavetto molding; 4 rails joining upper end of table legs; 4 rails joining table legs further down; 2 moldings pegged to lower edge of cavetto; 1 carved brace joining leg and top rail, traces of other seven remains.

Condition: Most of parts present: seven corner braces missing, eighth is chipped. Table surface deeply cracked.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.41E
labels.content: Designed with a slightly architectural quality in its flaring top, this table is fastened together with wooden pegs. Despite its small size, it was probably intended for use by adults, who would have been seated on low stools, like the one in this case, or on the floor.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
